definitions:
to be (essentially or identified as).


Yo soy de los Estados Unidos. ― I am from the United States.


Errar es humano. ― To err is human.

to be (in the passive voice sense)


La guitarra fue tocada. ― The guitar was played.

to exist; to occur


La fiesta será mañana. ― The party will be tomorrow.
description: ser (first-person singular present soy, first-person singular preterite fui, past participle sido)
etymology: Partially from Old Spanish seer, from Latin sedēre, present active infinitive of sedeō (“I sit, I reside”), from Proto-Italic *sedēō, from Proto-Indo-European *sed-, and partially from Vulgar Latin *essere, from Latin esse, present active infinitive of sum, from Proto-Italic *ezom, from Proto-Indo-European *h₁ésti (“I am, I exist”).
